title: When Vinod Khanna spoke about his rivalry with Big B
description: Vinod Khanna and Amitabh Bachchan entered Bollywood in the late 1960s during Rajesh Khanna's reign. As Amitabh rose with hits like Zanjeer, Vinod gained prominence through villainous roles. Their rivalry became apparent in films like Zameer and Hera Pheri, while their partnership thrived until Vinod decided to join Rajneesh’s ashram.

title: War 2: Kiara-Ayan twin in white in Italy - PICS
description: Kiara Advani shared a selfie with War 2 director Ayan Mukerji, exciting fans as they twinned in white during a 'Holy Sunday.' The photo, set to Wake Up Sid's Iktara, delighted fans online. War 2, directed by Mukerji, is set to release on August 14, 2025, continuing YRF’s spy universe.

title: Aamir Khan on Amitabh Bachchan's 82nd birthday
description: Amitabh Bachchan will turn 82 on October 11. The recent promo video of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' Season 16 featured a grand birthday celebration for Big B. The unwavering love from fans and participants made the actor visibly emotional. Aamir Khan also shared some valuable memories about Amitabh on this special occasion.

title: Varun-Shraddha-Kriti, Salim-Javed, PC-Malti: Top 5 news
description: In entertainment today, Varun Dhawan, Shraddha Kapoor, and Kriti Sanon may join Stree X Bhediya, while FIR writer Amit Aryan claims Salim-Javed plagiarized. Priyanka Chopra shared sweet moments with daughter Malti Marie on the Citadel 2 set. Saif Ali Khan returns for Race 4, and Ajay Devgn's fierce Singham Again look excites fans.

title: When Big B reacted to reports of Aishwarya being manglik
description: When Aishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan married in 2007, they encountered numerous baseless rumors, including claims that Aishwarya brought misfortune. Amitabh Bachchan later criticized this gossip, stressing the importance of their marital bond over public speculation. Today, the couple has a teenage daughter, Aaradhya, and lives in Mumbai with the Bachchan family.

title: Sujoy recalls Big B's support while making Kahaani
description: Sujoy Ghosh is known for the success of the Vidya Balan-starrer 'Kahaani', but he had a tough time with the box office failure of 'Aladin', starring Amitabh Bachchan, Riteish Deshmukh, and Jacqueline Fernandez in key roles. The director recently revealed that Amitabh stood by his side during those difficult times and offered support for his next venture.

title: Salman to cameo as Chulbul Pandey in Singham Again
description: Salman Khan is keeping his promise to Rohit Shetty about joining Singham Again as Chulbul Pandey. While he hasn't shot his scenes yet, he’s set to start soon. The film also stars Akshay Kumar, Ranveer Singh, Tiger Shroff, Kareena Kapoor Khan, and Deepika Padukone, expanding the popular Singham franchise.

title: Amar Kaushik on directing SRK and Salman
description: Bollywood director Amar Kaushik shares that his family measures his success by potential collaborations with superstars Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan. Despite their enthusiasm, Kaushik focuses on creating unique and heartfelt films, especially for younger audiences, while respecting the Khans’ massive fanbase.

title: Prakash caused Rs 1 Crore loss: Producer Vinod
description: Prakash Raj shared a photo with Tamil Nadu's Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin and Chief Minister MK Stalin on X (formerly Twitter). Producer S. Vinod Kumar accused Raj of causing a ₹1 crore loss by leaving a film set without notice. Raj has not responded to the claim. Social media buzzes with speculation about the incident.

title: Bobby Deol: A Journey from Stardom to Reinvention
description: Bobby Deol's career, which began with a promising debut in 'Barsaat,' faced ups and downs over the years. After fading stardom, his resurgence came through digital platforms like Netflix's 'Class of '83' and the web series 'Aashram.' Now, he has reestablished himself with Sandeep Reddy Vanga's Animal and has become the most sought after actors in antagonist roles be it Alpha, Thalapathy 69,and Kanguva.

title: When Vidya Balan said she does not understand open marriage
description: Vidya Balan expresses her opinion against open relationships, stating she values monogamy and cannot understand the concept of sharing a partner. Despite her personal stance, she does not judge others who find such relationships suitable. "I abhor this concept of open relationship. If it works for you, great, but I cannot fathom how it works for someone," she said. She is set to return in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' releasing in November.

title: Dimple Kapadia’s granddaughter Naomika takes internet by storm
description: Naomika Saran, granddaughter of Dimple Kapadia, is creating a buzz online with her captivating pictures. At 19, she is admired for her beauty and charm. She is often seen with her cousin Aarav, son of Twinkle Khanna and Akshay Kumar. Fans eagerly await any news of her Bollywood debut. You cannot miss the pictures of Noamika Saran. Take a look inside.

title: ASTRO have emotional reunion after 2 years
description: During the 'Dusk Till Dawn' fan meeting, ASTRO members Cha Eun Woo, MJ, and Jinjin surprised Sanha, creating an emotional moment with fans. They reminisced and performed their signature group greeting after two years. ASTRO launched a special digital single 'Circles' to mark their 8th anniversary.

title: Will Varun- Shraddha-Kriti come together in Stree x Bhediya film?
description: Varun Dhawan and Shraddha Kapoor's chemistry in 'Stree 2' song 'Khoobsurat' is winning hearts. Director Amar Kaushik hints at a possible romantic storyline involving characters from 'Stree' and 'Bhediya.' 'Stree 2' enjoys box office success while fans speculate on future installments. Rajkummar Rao confirms plans for 'Stree 3' with a promising concept.

title: Mathew Thomas praises Vijay’s punctuality
description: Mollywood actor Mathew Thomas expresses admiration for Thalapathy Vijay’s punctuality after working together in Lokesh Kanagaraj’s action film 'Leo'. Thomas is inspired by Vijay’s disciplined schedule and respectful behavior on set. Despite celebrating a crew member’s birthday until 2 am, Vijay was on set by 7 am the next morning, showcasing his commitment. Thomas' latest movie is the sports drama 'Cup', and he made a cameo appearance in the hit film 'Premalu'.

title: When SRK shared his kids were ‘better human beings’ than him
description: Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan, known for his humility, acknowledges that his children, Aryan, Suhana, and AbRam, are better human beings. Supporting their own aspirations, he did not guide them towards acting or engineering. Suhana has launched her acting career, while Aryan explores directing.

title: Prabhudeva-Nayanthara's relationship led to his divorce
description: Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan are a celebrated couple in showbiz, but Nayanthara’s previous relationship with Prabhudeva, which led to his divorce, had garnered significant attention. Their breakup was challenging, and although neither discussed the reasons, both have moved on with their lives.

title: Shraddha’s AWKWARD ramp walk leaves netizens divided
description: Shraddha Kapoor walked the ramp in New Delhi for a couture brand's Resonance 2024/25 collection, donning a stunning white lehenga. Discussion online is divided over her walk; some praised her grace, while others found it awkward, suggesting the outfit's weight as a possible cause. Despite mixed reviews, her appearance was widely appreciated. "She, as usual, looks fab, but it seems she is finding it difficult to walk in that lehenga,” a netizen commented.

title: Anees: I made Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 while sitting on one leg
description: Anees Bazmee returns with Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3, featuring Kartik Aaryan, Vidya Balan, and Triptii Dimri, amid speculation about Madhuri Dixit-Nene. Despite a severe leg injury before shooting, Bazmee completed most of the film while seated. Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 is set to release on November 1st, clashing with Ajay Devgn and Rohit Shetty's Singham Again.

title: Kareena reveals the most irritating habit about Karisma
description: B-town sisters Kareena Kapoor Khan and Karisma Kapoor share a close bond and are often seen supporting each other publicly. They when not engaging in playful banter they are each other's biggest cheerleaders, leaving no chance to express their admiration for one another's work.

title: Bigg Boss 18 house revealed: From cave-inspired interiors to a hammam-style bathroom!
description: Bigg Boss 18 house takes inspiration from caves and forts, with hidden entrances and earthy tones. The kitchen mimics a cave, while the bedroom feels like a regal fort. A Turkish hammam-style bathroom and secret doors add intrigue to this visually stunning, layered space.

title: YRF appoints Kanupriya as head of talent film strategy
description: YRF Talent has named Kanupriya the Head of Talent Film Strategy. Kanupriya, with over 15 years of industry experience, will lead film strategy and partnerships. Akanksha Malhotra is appointed as AVP of Talent. With 13 years of experience, she will support the film division and foster collaborations for YRF Talent’s actors.

title: Yash Raj Films to release Alpha in December 2025
description: Yash Raj Films announces its first female-led spy film, Alpha, starring Alia Bhatt and Sharvari, set to release in theaters on December 25, 2025. Directed by Shiv Rawail and produced by Aditya Chopra, the film aims to provide an action-packed holiday experience.

title: JioCinema announces appointment of YouTube India head Ishan Chatterjee as chief business officer
description: JioCinema has appointed Ishan Chatterjee as the new Chief Business Officer to enhance its tech-driven digital experience and boost revenue generation in sports and entertainment. With a robust background from YouTube India, Google, McKinsey, and Hindustan Unilever, Ishan will lead monetisation and growth strategies.

title: BookMyShow lodges complaint against black market sale of Coldplay concert tickets, investigation underway
description: BookMyShow has filed a complaint at the Vile Parle Police Station in Mumbai. They report an individual black marketing tickets for Coldplay's January 2025 concert in Navi Mumbai. The company began ticket sales on September 22 and warned against third-party purchases. Some customers tried to buy the maximum number of tickets and collected money from others.

title: Paradox Museum plans experiential centres in more Indian cities
description: The museum offers an immersive experience through optical illusions, featuring 55 paradox-themed exhibits and 15 immersive rooms. The company has already launched its first centre in Mumbai and is planning to expand to Hyderabad, Bengaluru, Chennai and the Delhi-NCR region within the next few years. Before launching in Mumbai, the company opened a centre in London.

title: Media companies to log 8% revenue growth, reaching Rs 60,000 crore by FY27: Crisil
description: Media companies are set to achieve 8% annual revenue growth, reaching Rs 60,000 crore by FY27, driven by digital segment expansion. This includes increased focus on OTT services, social media, and apps, alongside traditional ad revenue growth, improving operating margins to 18% by FY27.

title: Working out issues with CBFC over certificate for 'Emergency' film: Zee Entertainment tells HC
description: Zee Entertainment is in discussions with the Censor Board regarding the certification of 'Emergency', a film directed by Kangana Ranaut. The movie's release faced delays due to objections raised by Sikh organizations. Both parties are working towards a resolution. The court is set to hear the matter again on Friday.

title: ZEEL aims to deliver higher profitability through enhanced performance: MD& CEO Punit Goenka
description: ZEE Entertainment Enterprises Ltd aims to enhance profitability by focusing on frugality, quality content, and optimising performance across its businesses, according to MD & CEO Punit Goenka. The company has proposed workforce reduction and leadership salary cuts, while settling a dispute with Sony Pictures Networks India.

title: After 7 years probe, CBI files closure report in NDTV promoters cheating case
description: The CBI filed a closure report against former NDTV promoters Prannoy Roy and Radhika Roy in a 2009 ICICI Bank loan case, citing lack of legally tenable evidence. The case involved allegations of non-disclosure of pledged shares. NDTV had maintained all loans were repaid and rules followed.

title: Publicis Groupe India's research report shines a spotlight on India's Gen Z
description: Publicis Groupe India has unveiled a study focusing on Gen Z's preferences in media, finance, fashion, health, food, and beverages. The research has highlighted their values as experience seekers, purpose-driven explorers, and health-conscious individuals, emphasising authenticity, quick financial returns, sustainability and holistic well-being.

title: Mukta A2 Cinemas launches festive offer with ₹99 cap on F&B
description: Mukta A2 Cinemas has capped all food and beverage prices at ₹99 for the festive season to make cinema outings more affordable. COO Satwik Lele aims to enhance the overall experience for cinemagoers. This move comes amid industry discussions on high pricing, with average expenditure statistics provided by the Multiplex Association of India.

title: All about Ravi Ahuja who will be Sony Pictures Entertainment's new CEO from January 2, 2025
description: Sony Group Corporation has announced that Tony Vinciquerra will step down as SPE CEO. Ravi Ahuja will take over as the new CEO on January 2, 2025. Vinciquerra will remain as a non-executive Chairman until December 2025. Ahuja looks forward to leading SPE and working with talented colleagues worldwide.

title: Ravi Ahuja to take over as CEO of Sony Pictures as Tony Vinciquerra steps down
description: Tony Vinciquerra will step down as Sony Pictures Entertainment's Chairman and CEO in January 2025. Ravi Ahuja, the current Chairman of Global Television Studios, will take over the role. Vinciquerra will stay in an advisory role until the end of December 2025 while Ahuja will report to Sony Group Corporation's leading executives.

title: Coldplay ticket row: BookMyShow COO appears before EOW
description: Anil Makhija, COO of BookMyShow parent Big Tree Entertainment, appeared before Mumbai Police’s EOW regarding a complaint. The complaint alleges irregularities in ticket sales for Coldplay's India tour, accusing BookMyShow and Live Nation of using ticket bots. BookMyShow denies involvement, emphasizing their measures to ensure fairness.

title: Producers Guild of India re-elects Shibasish Sarkar as president for third term
description: Shibasish Sarkar has been unanimously re-elected as the president of the Producers Guild of India for the third consecutive term during the 69th Annual General Meeting in Mumbai. The meeting also saw the re-election of key Vice Presidents and Treasurers, with discussions on Media & Entertainment industry challenges and opportunities.

title: Coldplay 'fake tickets' row: BookMyShow COO appears before Mumbai police
description: Anil Makhija, COO of Big Tree Entertainment, appears before Mumbai Police’s EOW in the Coldplay concert ticket scam. Allegations claim BookMyShow used bots to hinder genuine purchases, inflating the digital queue and causing fan outrage. CEO Ashish Hemrajani missed his second summon.

title: Reliance's Viacom18-Disney merger: Govt approves transfer of licence to Star India
description: The government has approved the transfer of non-news TV channel licenses from Reliance Industries' Viacom18 to Star India. This move follows the merger approval by NCLT and conditions set by the Competition Commission of India. The combined entity will be India's largest media house, with Reliance holding a majority stake.

title: Viacom18 gets I&B ministry approval to transfer TV channels to Star
description: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has approved the transfer of TV channel licences from Viacom18 to Star India, completing the final step in their merger. This merger, valued at $8.5 billion, will create a media giant with 117 channels across various genres, expected to generate significant cost and revenue synergies.

title: Don't miss these OTT releases this week: Stree 2, Ulajh, Taaza Khabar 2 and more!
description: OTT releases this week: Several new movies and web series are set to premiere on OTT platforms this weekend. Let's explore the titles you can stream online!

title: Yash Chopra’s Birth Anniversary: Must watch films of the legendary filmmaker
description: The master of romance in Indian cinema, Yash Chopra, made a lasting impression with his captivating narrative and endearing characters.

title: 'Ramesh Sippy didn't direct the entire Sholay': Sachin Pilgaonkar reveals Gabbar Amjad Khan and he shot most of the film
description: Actor-director Sachin Pilgaonkar reminisces about working on the iconic film Sholay as an assistant director. He reveals that Ramesh Sippy only directed scenes with main stars, while a second unit handled action sequences. Sachin and Amjad Khan were given the opportunity to represent Sippy for these scenes, enhancing their directorial skills.

title: 'Singham Again', 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' to vie for Diwali box office collections
description: The Hindi film industry is abuzz with the upcoming Diwali clash between 'Singham Again' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3'. Despite concerns about box office cannibalization, producers believe their different genres will attract varied audiences. Industry experts are optimistic, citing the long weekend and lack of major releases in the following weeks.

title: Power & authority come in way of checking spam on OTT platforms
description: DoT and Trai are struggling to curb spam and scams on OTT platforms like WhatsApp, Telegram, and Signal. While WhatsApp is cooperating to some extent, there is little control over Telegram and Signal. Telcos are concerned as their measures do not work on these unregulated platforms.

title: Tata Play Binge powers OTT aggregation platform Cignal Super in Philippines
description: Tata Play Binge is expanding its global reach by providing Platform as a Service to Cignal TV's OTT platform, Cignal Super, in the Philippines. The app, built with Tata Play Binge’s cloud technology, will offer unified access to various OTT services. This follows a similar collaboration with Akash TV in Bangladesh.

title: India on cusp of entertainment revolution driven by tech, diverse content: Kevin Vaz
description: India is on the brink of an entertainment revolution, driven by technology and evolving consumer behavior, says Kevin Vaz, CEO of Broadcast Entertainment at Viacom18. He highlights the growth potential in media consumption and the success of Viacom18's brands like Colors and Nickelodeon, emphasizing the importance of regional content and multi-screen experiences.

title: Multiplex Association defends dynamic ticket pricing, average price in 2023 at Rs 130
description: The Multiplex Association of India (MAI) defended dynamic cinema pricing, which varies based on several factors, in response to filmmaker Karan Johar's remarks on high costs. MAI stated that the average ticket price is Rs 130 and highlighted discounts and promotions that make cinema outings more affordable for families.

title: Paris Fashion Week 2024: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Alia Bhatt, Sonam Kapoor represented India
Lights, camera, legal action: Netflix faces Bollywood drama over Rs 47 crore dispute
description: The Economic Offences Wing of Mumbai Police has initiated a preliminary enquiry following a complaint by Bollywood producer Vashu Bhagnani against a company linked to Netflix and others. Bhagnani alleges cheating and conspiracy over rights for three films, claiming he has not received ₹47.37 crore. Netflix denies the allegations.

title: FDI in I&B sector falls 31% in Q1; Walt Disney tops with ₹2.8k-crore investment
description: The information and broadcasting sector in India saw a 31% decline in foreign direct investment during the first quarter of this financial year, attracting ₹3,374 crore. Major investments included Walt Disney's ₹2,839 crore in Star India and Uday Shankar and James Murdoch's ₹4,306 crore into Viacom18.

title: Oscars 2025: 'Laapataa Ladies' picked as India's entry; how Kiran Rao reacted, top film contenders and other details
Audible, Disney launch three original audio series
description: Audible and Disney Publishing have released three new Audible Originals featuring stories from Frozen, Cars, and Star Wars. These titles join a collection of 60 classic Disney audiobooks available exclusively on Audible. The launch coincides with the introduction of Kids Profiles, allowing parents to share curated audio content in a child-friendly environment.

title: Rs 3.4 lakh for a Coldplay concert ticket? Frustrated fans say 'people are buying to make money, not to attend'
description: Over 1.3 crore Coldplay fans rushed to buy tickets for the band’s Mumbai concerts, resulting in a sell-out of all 1.5 lakh tickets within 30 minutes. Resale platforms took advantage of the demand, with ticket prices soaring up to ₹10 lakh. Fans expressed outrage on social media, highlighting issues with reseller sites and inflated prices. BookMyShow added a third show to address the overwhelming demand but faced ongoing criticism from fans over unfair ticketing practices.

title: Now playing! Second show of movies at theatres near you
description: Re-releasing old films has revitalized theaters, helping exhibitors cover costs and attract audiences. PVR INOX re-released 50 films, generating 60 lakh footfalls and significant revenue. This strategy has proven effective, especially among Generation Z, and will continue when new film releases are limited.

title: Sony India to revamp SET, plug content gap
description: Sony Pictures Networks India, under new CEO Gaurav Banerjee, is revamping Sony Entertainment Television to improve its market share. The channel will focus on enhancing its fiction content while continuing popular non-fiction shows. SPNI also aims to strengthen SAB TV and explore regional TV opportunities for future growth.

title: Now playing! Second show of movies at theatres near you
description: Re-releasing old films has revived theaters, helping exhibitors cover costs and attract audiences. Films like Rockstar, Ghilli, Laila Majnu, and Tumbbad have seen strong responses, generating significant footfalls and boosting food and beverage sales. This strategy has proven effective in the absence of new blockbusters, with re-released films contributing to 4% of annual footfalls at multiplexes.

title: India probing Netflix for visa violations, racial discrimination, email shows
description: India is investigating Netflix's local operations for alleged visa violations, tax evasion, and racial discrimination. The probe follows a government email to a former Netflix executive, Nandini Mehta, who is also suing the company in the U.S. for wrongful termination and discrimination. Netflix claims it is unaware of any investigation.

title: As big-budget films continue to bomb, Bollywood stops shooting for stars; more and more movies shelved
description: The Hindi film industry has seen a rise in shelved big-budget films, with 30-40 projects halted in the past one year and a half. High costs, shifting audience tastes, and stars failing to guarantee strong box-office openings are major factors. Streaming platforms have also reduced investments, impacting producers' revenues.

title: Disney Star secures exclusive rights for T10 global tournaments
description: Disney Star has partnered with T Ten Global to broadcast four major T10 cricket tournaments in India over the next four months. The deal includes coverage of Zim Afro T10, US Masters T10, Abu Dhabi T10, and Lanka T10 in multiple languages. This collaboration aims to bring fast-paced cricket action to Indian fans.

title: Govt wants 30 seconds mandatory anti-tobacco Ad as soon as you open an OTT app, and you can't skip it
description: The Union health ministry has proposed mandatory non-skippable anti-tobacco health spots and audio-visual disclaimers on OTT platforms. These rules, effective from September 1, 2023, require a 30-second spot at the beginning and middle of films and a 20-second disclaimer upon opening the platform.

title: Stree 2, Tumbbad & others attract 60 lakh to theatres in one day to set National Cinema Day record
description: The Multiplex Association of India reported a record turnout on National Cinema Day, with over 60 lakh people attending theatres. The event featured films for Rs 99 per ticket across 4,000 screens. Major releases and regional films drew large crowds, showcasing the enduring appeal of cinema despite recent industry challenges.

title: Asian Cricket Council faces a tough media rights test
description: The Asian Cricket Council's media rights sale for the 2024-31 cycle will be a significant event, with a base price set at $170 million. Major players like Star India, Viacom18, Sony Pictures Networks India, Zee Entertainment, and FanCode are expected to participate. The auction comes amid industry consolidation and budget constraints due to previous commitments to other cricket properties.

title: Corner Office Conversation with Monika Shergill, VP, Content, Netflix India
Israel: Mossad’s daring spy ops that became iconic movie plots
description: Mossad, Israel's renowned intelligence agency, has a storied history of audacious missions that often blur the lines between reality and thriller. From infiltrating enemy territories to orchestrating rescue missions, Mossad's daring tactics have captivated the public and filmmakers alike. This article explores notable films inspired by real-life Mossad missions.

title: Dubai-based GXR acquires media rights to European football leagues for India
description: Galaxy Racer (GXR), a Dubai-based transmedia company, has secured media rights for LaLiga, Serie A, Ligue 1, and Ligue 2 in the Indian subcontinent starting from the 2024/25 season. The matches will be streamed live and free-to-air, enhancing fan engagement through GXR’s innovative Super App.

title: Video on demand category generated $1.04 billion in revenues during H1 2024
description: The premium video-on-demand market in India saw a significant rise in the first half of 2024, generating $1.04 billion in revenues. Local content, especially live sports and dramas, drove engagement. Jio Cinema, Netflix, and Disney+ Hotstar led the revenue charts, with cricket events like IPL and ICC World Cup boosting viewership.

title: Box office pins hopes on festive 'hits' as silver screen fails to dazzle
description: Box-office collections in India for the first eight months of 2024 have dropped by 7.5% compared to last year, due to underperforming films and fewer big releases amid elections and cricket events. However, the second half of the year is expected to see strong performances with anticipated releases like Pushpa 2 and Singham 3.

title: Star claims $940 million damages from ZEE over failed deal
description: Star India, owned by Walt Disney, has sought $940 million in damages from Zee Entertainment for not honoring a $1.5 billion ICC TV rights deal. Zee refuted the claims and stated that arbitration is still in its initial stages. The matter will likely continue post Star's merger with Viacom18.

title: Star files Statement of Case in London court against ZEE, seeks $940 million in damages

Despite a 7% rise in subscription revenue to ₹3,346 crore, advertising revenue fell by 11% to ₹2,912 crore. The planned merger with Zee Entertainment was terminated.

title: Stars coming down from sky-high fee to get movies rolling
description: A-list actors are cutting their fees by up to 30% and taking a large part of remuneration from profits. This new trend helps get films off the ground in a challenging funding environment. Producers find it easier to raise funds as actors take smaller upfront fees, easing the burden on the production houses.

The premium VOD sector saw significant revenue growth, driven by local content and live sports.
